    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent evt)
      actionPerformed waits for Actions to the three buttons
      void addMyActionListenerForKeys(java.awt.event.ActionListener al)
      This method allows to add an ActionListener, which will report on all pressed alphabetical keys - you have to generate a class e.g. like follows in your code class MyKeyAction extends AbstractAction { public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) { switch (e.getActionCommand().charAt(0)) { case 'a': System.out.println("a pressed"); ... } } } and add an Object ot this class as ActionListener to the MyCanvas-object mycanvas.addMyActionListener(new MyKeyAction);
      void clearScreen()
      clears the Screen (everything white)
      void copyPixel(int x, int y, int xTarget, int yTarget)
      copy a single pixel
      void drawCircle(int x, int y, double radius)
      draw a circle
      void drawGrid(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2, int zeilen, int spalten)
      draw a grid / table
      void drawLine(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2)
      draw a simple line in chosen color from point (x1,y1) to (x2,y2) (0,0) is in upper left corner
      void fillCircle(int x, int y, double radius)
      drawing a filled circle
      void paint(java.awt.Graphics gr) 
      void plotPixel(int x1, int y1)
      drawing a single pixel
      void restoreView()
      restores view - means that background image will be copied to front graphics
      void setColor(int c)
      simple way of choosing the color (e.g. type mycanvas.setColor(Color.gruen);
      void setOnlyBackground(boolean b)
      if set to true - drawing actions will only happen on the background image you have to call restoreView on your own.
      void wait(int pause)
      wait for a short amount of time
      void writeText(int x1, int y1, java.lang.String s)
      writing a textString with size 14
      void writeText(int x1, int y1, java.lang.String s, int size)
      writing a textString

        public void setOnlyBackground(boolean b)
        if set to true - drawing actions will only happen on the background image you have to call restoreView on your own.
        Parameters:

      • addMyActionListenerForKeys

        public void addMyActionListenerForKeys(java.awt.event.ActionListener al)
        This method allows to add an ActionListener, which will report on all pressed alphabetical keys - you have to generate a class e.g. like follows in your code 
         class MyKeyAction extends AbstractAction {
        public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
                switch (e.getActionCommand().charAt(0)) { 
                case 'a':
                        System.out.println("a pressed");
                        ... 
                }
        }
 }
        and add an Object ot this class as ActionListener to the MyCanvas-object mycanvas.addMyActionListener(new MyKeyAction);
        Parameters:
        al - Action Listener

        public void drawGrid(double x1,
                     double y1,
                     double x2,
                     double y2,
                     int zeilen,
                     int spalten)
        draw a grid / table
        Parameters:
        x1 - x of upper left corner
        y1 - y of upper left corner
        x2 - x lower right corner
        y2 - y lower right corner
        zeilen - number of rows
        spalten - number of columns
